intro: Tofieldia calyculata subsp. borealis, commonly known as the northern tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in moist, rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. It is often found in tundra and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, short growing seasons. Its botanical features are well adapted to the harsh conditions of its northern habitat.
